data.title: Oando PLC acquires Nigerian AGIP oil company
data.meta_description: Oando PLC has declared a concurrence with ENI over the 100% securing of Nigerian AGIP Oil Organization Restricted shares. The organization, Oando, uncovered this on Monday in an explanation obtained by Everyday POST.
data.text:
LinkedIn and 3rd parties use essential and non-essential cookies to provide, secure, analyze and improve our Services, and to show you relevant ads (including professional and job ads) on and off LinkedIn. Learn more in our Cookie Policy.

Select Accept to consent or Reject to decline non-essential cookies for this use. You can update your choices at any time in your settings.

Oando PLC has declared a concurrence with ENI over the 100% securing of Nigerian AGIP Oil Organization Restricted shares. The organization, Oando, uncovered this on Monday in an explanation obtained by Everyday POST. "Nigeria's driving native energy arrangements supplier recorded on both the Nigerian Trade Restricted and Johannesburg Stock Trade is satisfied to declare that it has agreed with Eni ("ENI") (a coordinated energy organization effectively supporting an equitable energy change, to accomplish Net-Zero fossil fuel byproducts by 2050 and advance productive and manageable admittance to energy for all), for the securing of 100% of the portions of Nigerian Agip Oil Organization Restricted (NAOC Ltd)."Completion of the exchange is dependent upon Pastoral Assent and other required administrative endorsements", the assertion contained. The ramifications are that the exchange has expanded Oando's ongoing part interests in OMLs 60, 61, 62, and 63 from 20 percent to 40 percent.

Likewise, it has expanded Oando's possession stake in all NEPL/NAOC/OOL Joint Endeavor resources and framework, which incorporate forty found oil and gas fields, of which 24 are at present delivering, roughly forty recognized prospects and leads, twelve creation stations, around 1,490 km of pipelines, three gas handling plants, the Metal Waterway Oil Terminal, the Kwale-Okpai stages 1 and 2 power plants (with an all-out nameplate limit of 960MW), and related framework.
